hypothesis_content.title: Asymmetric ETF Flow Response to Negative BTC News
hypothesis_content.statement: When a significant negative catalyst (e.g., 'scarier macro catalyst' headline) causes a >5% BTC price decline, but the next day's US spot Bitcoin ETF flows are net positive (>+$100M), the price will recover the entire previous day's loss within the subsequent 48 trading hours, outperforming a simple mean reversion baseline.
hypothesis_content.rationale: This tests whether institutional ETF buying is a stronger force than retail/news-driven selling. Positive flows amidst negative news indicate institutional conviction and dip-buying, which can overwhelm the initial catalyst's sentiment. The entry timing aligns flow data with the next liquidity window.
entry_conditions: BTC experiences a >5% single-day decline on a clear negative macro/regulatory headline
The following US trading day's net spot Bitcoin ETF flows (aggregate) are positive and exceed +$100M
Enter long at the open of the US equity market (9:30 AM ET) on the day after the positive flows are reported
BTC price is still below the pre-catalyst-open level from two days prior

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches the daily close price from the day BEFORE the initial catalyst-driven drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops below the intraday low of the catalyst-driven drop day
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry (close of second trading day)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Positive ETF flows following a negative-news drop fail to catalyze a full recovery more than 50% of the time, indicating the selling pressure from the catalyst is more persistent or that ETF flows are not a timely leading indicator.
